heroIntro:
Welcome to your ideal retirement home in Guardamar del Segura. This 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment offers the perfect blend of affordability and quality living on Spain's Costa Blanca. At €299,500 with premium specifications, you're looking at exceptional value—50% less expensive than comparable properties in nearby Jávea—making this an intelligent choice for retirees seeking both comfort and financial prudence.

Guardamar del Segura has become increasingly popular with expats seeking a relaxed lifestyle away from the busier coastal hotspots. The town maintains a genuinely Spanish character while offering excellent healthcare facilities, modern amenities, and a welcoming international community. With 300+ days of annual sunshine and a gentle Mediterranean climate, this location is ideal for enjoying an active, peaceful retirement.

This apartment represents more than just a property purchase—it's an investment in a new chapter of your life. The 72m² space is thoughtfully designed for comfortable living, with practical layouts and modern finishes. Whether you're looking to retire permanently or split your time between Spain and home, this property offers flexibility, value, and the promise of stress-free living in one of Europe's most desirable retirement destinations.
areaSection: Guardamar del Segura is a charming coastal town located in southern Alicante Province, strategically positioned between the busier resorts of Torrevieja and Alicante. This 8,000-resident municipality retains authentic Spanish character while welcoming an international community of retirees and expats. The town sits along a beautiful 10km stretch of Mediterranean coastline, featuring Blue Flag beaches backed by protected dunes and pine forests. Geographically, Guardamar benefits from its position within the Valencia region, offering easy access to both Alicante's airport (45 minutes) and larger towns without the overcrowding of commercial beach destinations. The climate is consistently mild and sunny year-round, with average temperatures hovering around 17°C in winter and 28°C in summer, making outdoor activities accessible throughout the year.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Guardamar del Segura revolves around a relaxed, Mediterranean rhythm that's particularly appealing to retirees. Mornings might begin with a walk along one of the town's pristine beaches or a coffee at a local café where Spanish and international residents mix naturally. The Wednesday market offers fresh produce, local goods, and genuine social interaction. Healthcare is a major strength—the town hosts a Centro de Salud, multiple private clinics, and proximity to Hospital de Torrevieja ensures peace of mind. The expat community here is substantial but less overwhelming than Torrevieja, creating a balanced environment where you can enjoy both international friendships and Spanish culture. Restaurants serve everything from traditional Spanish cuisine to international favorites. Golf enthusiasts have access to three championship courses within 20 minutes. Shopping is convenient with Mercadona, Consum, and Lidl supermarkets dotted throughout town, plus weekly markets for fresh local produce.
investmentSection: From an investment perspective, this property offers compelling returns and stability. The Costa Blanca residential market has appreciated 7% year-on-year, outpacing inflation and delivering real wealth growth. Guardamar del Segura specifically offers stronger value than more famous spots—properties here are priced significantly below comparable Jávea homes, yet increasingly attractive to both retirees and holiday renters. The typical weekly rental for this property type commands €700, suggesting solid short-term rental potential if you choose to monetize periods when you're not using it. With purchase prices still reasonable compared to other European retirement destinations and Spanish property taxes modest, this apartment represents an intelligent diversification of your retirement portfolio while providing a ready-made home for enjoying Mediterranean life.
conclusion: This 2-bedroom apartment in Guardamar del Segura represents a thoughtful investment in your retirement future. You're not simply purchasing property—you're gaining entry to a relaxed Mediterranean lifestyle, a welcoming expat community, excellent healthcare, year-round sunshine, and a genuinely affordable home for one of Europe's most desirable coastal regions. At €299,500 with premium specifications, the value is compelling. The coastal charm, Spanish authenticity, and investment potential combine to create genuine long-term appeal. Whether you're planning to retire here full-time or split your year between Spain and home, this property accommodates flexible living. lifeAndAmenities.intro: Guardamar del Segura has evolved into a well-equipped town that caters to both daily needs and lifestyle preferences. Unlike remote properties, this location puts essential services, entertainment, and natural beauty within minutes of your home.

healthcare.text: Healthcare quality in Guardamar del Segura exceeds expectations for a town of its size. The Centro de Salud Guardamar provides primary care with Spanish-speaking and English-speaking medical professionals. Hospital de Torrevieja, Spain's leading private hospital, is just 15 minutes away by car and specializes in care for international residents and expats. Multiple private clinics throughout town offer specialized services, from cardiology to physiotherapy. Medical tourism infrastructure means doctors understand the needs of foreign patients. Prescription medications are affordable, and the Spanish healthcare system ranks among Europe's best. Emergency services are responsive, and medical tourism coordinators can assist with paperwork and insurance arrangements.
keyPoints: Centro de Salud Guardamar - 8 minutes walk, English-speaking staff
Hospital de Torrevieja - 15 minutes, leading private hospital
Affordable prescription medications and healthcare costs

education.text: While primarily targeted at retirement buyers, educational options exist for visiting grandchildren or younger family members. The area has Spanish public schools within Guardamar, and international British curriculum schools are located in nearby Torrevieja, approximately 20 minutes away. El Limonar, a reputable international school, operates nearby. Most retirees find this aspect less critical, but the infrastructure supports occasional childcare needs or extended family visits during school holidays.
keyPoints: Spanish public schools in Guardamar del Segura

shopping.text: Daily shopping is straightforward and convenient in Guardamar del Segura. Mercadona, Spain's largest supermarket chain, has multiple locations throughout town with comprehensive product ranges and quality products. Consum and Lidl offer budget-conscious alternatives with excellent quality. The Wednesday weekly market in the town center provides fresh produce, local goods, and daily interaction with neighbors. Larger shopping centers in nearby Torrevieja offer expanded selection for occasional major purchases. Most residents find they can handle 80% of shopping needs within five minutes' walk of home.
keyPoints: Consum and Lidl supermarkets - budget options nearby
Wednesday weekly market - fresh produce and local goods

transport.text: Getting around Guardamar del Segura is manageable for active retirees. A car is recommended for maximum independence and flexibility—parking throughout town is straightforward and affordable. Public transport includes buses to Torrevieja and Alicante, running reliably for those preferring not to drive. Alicante International Airport is 45 minutes by car, making it convenient for international flights and visiting family. The town's compact size means most amenities are within walking distance or a short drive. Taxis are available, reasonably priced, and drivers are accustomed to serving expat residents.

Public buses to Torrevieja and Alicante available

faqs.question: Hur mycket kostar denna fastighet?
faqs.answer: €299,500. This 2-bedroom apartment offers premium specifications at 50% less than comparable Jávea properties, making it exceptional value for retirement buyers. Payment options and financing arrangements can be discussed with our team.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca en bra plats att köpa fastighet?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Costa Blanca combines proven property appreciation (7% annually), excellent climate, established infrastructure, and a thriving expat community. The region consistently ranks among Europe's most popular retirement destinations for legitimate reasons—affordability, healthcare quality, and lifestyle appeal.

faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. EU and non-EU citizens can purchase property in Spain with equal rights. No restrictions exist on foreign ownership. The process is straightforward, requiring a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and professional legal assistance—standard practice for all property purchases.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €299,500 purchase price, expect approximately 10-12% in additional costs: property transfer tax (6-8%), notary fees (0.5-1%), registration fees (0.1%), and legal professional fees (0.5-1%). These costs are transparent and clearly disclosed before purchase. Mortgage-related fees may apply if financing.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca bra för pensionärer?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is excellent for retirees. The combination of year-round mild climate, healthcare quality, affordable cost of living (30-40% less than Northern Europe), and established expat community creates ideal retirement conditions. Guardamar specifically offers authentic Spanish living without overcrowding.

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is notably affordable. Groceries cost 30-40% less than UK or Scandinavia. Utilities, dining, and services are similarly inexpensive. A comfortable retirement budget for two people is €1,200-1,500 monthly, including housing. This property's modest price enables sustainable long-term living.

faqs.question: Hur långt är det från Sverige till Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport (45 minutes from this property) offers direct flights to UK airports (3-4 hours flight time). Budget airlines provide affordable connections. Many retirees maintain UK connections while enjoying Mediterranean living, visiting family regularly without difficulty.

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. Costa Blanca enjoys 300+ annual sunshine days with average temperatures of 17°C in winter and 28°C in summer. Rain is minimal and sporadic. This climate enables year-round outdoor activities—beach walks, golf, markets—without extreme weather challenges or heating/cooling costs.

faqs.question: What will this apartment generate in rental income?
faqs.answer: This property type typically commands €700 weekly (€2,800 monthly) in Guardamar del Segura's rental market. Annual gross rental income would approximate €36,400, representing 12% gross yield. Many owners rent during personal absence periods, generating income while retaining personal usage.

faqs.question: Why is this property priced at €299,500 when Guardamar's average is lower?
faqs.answer: This premium price reflects premium specifications—modern finishes, quality construction, excellent condition, and ready-to-occupy status. Comparing to Jávea (€5,900/m²), this property at €4,160/m² represents outstanding value. You're paying for quality, not location premium.
